New Records: The Yankees clinched their 32nd consecutive winning season, the second-longest streak in Major League history behind the 1926-64 Yankees.
Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt pitched into the fifth inning, combining with Nestor Cortes on a four-hitter in the Yankees' 2-0 victory over the Cubs on Saturday afternoon at Wrigley Field.
Wells knocked in Gleyber Torres with the game's first run on a first-inning groundout, and New York added another run with an aggressive sixth-inning double steal.
Catcher Christian Bethancourt's throw went down the left-field line, allowing Aaron Judge to trot home.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Aaron Boone said the right-hander “had a little bit of everything going,” limiting the Cubs to four hits in a 75-pitch effort.
Post-Match Reflections: Boone said that he has not yet decided how six arms will fit into a five-man rotation -- and in a playoff series, one fewer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win also secured their first series victory since taking two of three from the Rockies on Aug. 23-25.
Cortes, who walked one and struck out three in a 48-pitch appearance, said he was told his next start will come against the Red Sox in New York.
Others: Schmidt said he was initially irked about the move to the bullpen, but Boone said that the southpaw handled the assignment as “a professional.”
